channel.title: The "How do i set up a server" Thread
channel.description:
Well I'm sure everyone is getting tired of newcomers spamming this forum with questions that have been answered a million times.
So please keep all your threads regarding setting up server problems, how-to's etc.
Before you ask your questions please state which source you are using, what your problem is. Make sure you read through this thread for other people's problems first.
The reason of this Thread is because asking how to set up a server, or help fixing error's to get it running is not RSC Server Development.

item.title: The "How do i set up a server" Thread
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

[quote=“Archee90, post:6, topic:217348”]I would like to know how to set up a RSCD Based server and how do I get the client to it … I already know how to set up a divinepk server but I would like to know about RSCD.

Please

And thank you ~[/quote]its pretty much the same, you import the db after you installed easyphp or wamp, you run the site, you make sure the apache ant and java environmental variables are set correctly, you start the runserver and login server, and you log in with the client.
its simple to do.

Read full topic
item.source: The "How do i set up a server" Thread

item.title: The "How do i set up a server" Thread
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

this is probably going to get locked, but i hope it doesnt because it will cut down on so much spam.
well actually, it might, or it might not. noobs often dont look, they just randomly post topics in the wrong section without looking for any help on how to get it working without having to make a thread. hopefully they will use this instead of making new topics.

Read full topic
